result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvaro Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Written Lease <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(e).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Must get high school diploma, GED or HSED. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Charges per attached AMENDED criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 1/8/2016: Co Signature bond with father Alvaro Gonzalez, DOB 8-21-1970. Must reside at his father's home: 1316 Buchanan Street. Defendant to be placed on house arrest with GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). May only leave for court, meetings with his attorney and for medical appointments but must be with his father. May not have contact with the victim and may not have friends over. Also father is to have control over cell phone, internet, may not use social media and must get his father's permission on who he can speak with.
